title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 272.3 - Hold harmless clauses
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 272.3 - Hold harmless clauses

State Regulations

Licensees shall release and save harmless the people of the

State of New York from any and all damages, claims for damages or suits that
may arise or occur directly or indirectly as a result of any operation carried
on under and pursuant to said license. Licensees shall release the State from
any and all claims, damages and/or rights of action which shall accrue to the
licensee or any of its employees or agents that may arise or occur directly or
indirectly as a result of any operation carried on under or pursuant to said
license. Licensee at his own expense shall defend any and all suits against the

State of New York which may be brought by third parties as a result of any
operation carried on pursuant to or in accordance with the terms of such
license. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
272.3

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
